Tucson felt bad for Perceptor.  He knew how he was feeling.  It was uncerta=
in for even himself if his sight could ever be regained.

" I understand ho=
w you feel.  It's still uncertain if even I will be able to see again, and =
that too, saddens me somewhat, but we'll never really know unless we seek t=
hat second opinion.  How would you like to come with me, back to the ark, a=
nd see what the medic has to say to us? I'll be right beside you and what h=
appens, happens.  If we don't then we know we tried and we didn't give up."=


He was not about to give up on Perceptor, nor anyone else.
